newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft spending $400 mln on Internet in '96 - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft spending $400 mln on Internet in '96 - WSJ.

text.p: Microsoft Corp plans to spend $400 million this year to develop content for its Internet services and nearly as much in each of the next few years, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.
The newspaper quoted the company's executive vice president as saying it did not expect to register a profit until after that investment had been made.

It said Steve Ballmer told an industry conference that Microsoft's investments in its Microsoft Network on-line service, MSNBC Internet news and cable-television outlet and other Internet outposts had already cost it between $300 million and $400 million this year.
It said Ballmer did not expect the company's efforts in on-line media services and products to stop "bleeding cash" until three years from now.
"We're going to lose a lot of money before we break even," he said.
